messages: e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (21:47): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01, do you have any outstanding comments on the media queries editor's draft?
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (21:55): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0, s/emtpy/empty/
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (21:56): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0, maybe the definition of the 'not' keyword should also say that it changes true queries to become false?
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (21:56): (I'm just reading the spec through.)
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (21:56): I guess it says that later, though, so never mind.
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (21:59): you did use this spec when implementing right?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (21:59): ok
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (21:59): but I commented on it a number of times while doing that
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (21:59): But I assume you saw those comments...
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (21:59): yeah, those issues should've been addressed by now
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:05): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0, what about http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-style/2008Apr/0051.html ?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (22:09): that behavior would change, but "unknown, screen" would not
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:09): I prefer going back
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (22:09): how would you serialize in the CSSOM?
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:10): partly because it's nice for implementations to only need to keep a list of the types they support
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:10): rather than keeping a list of all types
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:10): which is more generally how CSS error handling works
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:10): I'd serialize by just spitting the name back out; we store it as a string anyway.
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:10): (atomized)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (22:10): it also seems weird to drop 'not unknown and (x)' and not drop 'not unknown'
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (22:11): that's actually the main reason
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:11): not if you think of 'screen' as equivalent to '(type: "screen")'
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:12): my bigger concern is that I'd really rather not have to put a list of *all* media types in the code
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:12): because that's going to need maintainence over time as specs add media types
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:12): or change the name of the aural/speech/whatever media type
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:12): I'd rather just have to know which media types we support
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:12): just like I only know which media features we support
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:12): or like we only know which properties we support
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (22:12): why'd you need to include media types you don't support?

104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:13): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0, because the spec currently says we have to apply a style sheet with "not embossed" and NOT apply a stylesheet with "not nonexistent"
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:13): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0, so we'd have to keep a list of all the types we don't support
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:14): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0, that doesn't fit with other CSS error handling (properties we don't support, etc.)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (22:14): I see
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:14): Right now, that's a list of 10 or so types... although it seems to be different in every spec, and it could grow significantly in the  future...
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (22:15): I guess I'd prefer "not embossed" to not work either if the implementation doesn't do embossed
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:15): that seems even weirder
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (22:15): I guess
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:15): so if we suddenly add projection style sheet support, we'll suddenly start applying "not projection" sheets to screen media, where we didn't before?
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:15): (Remember, the point of the error handling rules is largely about extensibility.)
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (22:16): anyway, lunchtime
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (22:17): you can make the same argument for starting to support (x) in the expression 'not screen and (x)'
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (22:18): anyway, I should probably go home
